questions.question: Create a Java class that given a number with 5 digits, returns true if it's a palindromic number (means "capic√∫a" in Spanish and "nombre palindrome" in French), otherwise return false.
You want to find out the value of the last element of an array. You write the following code. What will happen when you compile and run it?
questions.code: public class MyAr { public static void main(String argv[]){ int[] i = new int[5]; System.out.println(i[5]); }}

questions.question: Which of the following statements about abstract classes in java are true? (Select all correct answers)
options: A class must be declared abstract if one or more methods are abstract.
A class can be declared abstract if one or more methods are abstract.
A class can be declared abstract without abstract methods.
An abstract class cannot be instanciated.
